availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Wood Pulliam on March 17, 1836. Married to Louisa M. Alexander Pulliam on September 3, 1853. Father of Judson Pulliam, Robert Pulliam, John Pulliam, and Davis Pulliam. Carpenter in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Carpenter in Harrodsburg in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Harrodsburg in 1860. First lieutenant, sergeant, major, and commissary in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from 1862 to 1865.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, County Marriages, Film #000191861, p. 534.
